intro: Phacelia brannanii, commonly known as Brannan's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. It blooms in the spring and early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
